intro: Wettinia fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered wettinia, is a flowering plant species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Wettinia fascicularis is typically found growing in shaded, humid environments, often as an understory plant in tropical rainforests.
